conbody.p: All operational information and user settings are displayed and accessed from the UIM. The UIM houses the control system's liquid crystal display (LCD) touch screen. See .

section.title: The Desktop Screen
section.p: During normal operation, the control system displays the desktop screen on the LCD, which is the default screen. The control system returns to the desktop screen when there are no active Fault or Alert conditions, or when there has been no user input for several minutes. The information on the screen is as follows:

ul.li: Manufacturer and water-heater model information is displayed in title bar at the top of the desktop screen. Menu titles display in the title bar when navigating the control system menus.
The first temperature shown on the desktop screen, Tank Temperature, is the temperature of the water inside the water heater's storage tank.
The second temperature shown on the desktop screen is the Operating Set Point. The Operating Set Point is the temperature at which the control system maintains the water inside the storage tank.
Beneath the Operating Set Point is the status line. The status line shows the current operational state of the control system in real time. See for a description of the various operational states.
The desktop screen also displays animated status icons to convey operational information. See for descriptions of the status icons.
